intro: Rhaphidophora neglecta, commonly known as the neglected arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are often variegated with white or yellow markings, adding ornamental value. Rhaphidophora neglecta is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
